description: Updates a domain recordset after it is created. The update domain entry operation supports tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by domain name. For more information, see the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: The name of the domain recordset to update.

parameters.name: domainEntry
parameters.description: An array of key-value pairs containing information about the domain entry. id (string) --- The ID of the domain recordset entry. name (string) --- The name of the domain. target (string) --- The target IP address ( 192.0.2.0), or AWS name server ( ns-111.awsdns-22.com.). For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com. For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net. For Lightsail container services, the value looks like container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com. Be sure to also set isAlias to true when setting up an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container service. isAlias (boolean) --- When true, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias used by the Lightsail load balancer, Lightsail container service, Lightsail content delivery network (CDN) distribution, or another Amazon Web Services resource. You can include an alias (A type) record in your request, which points to the DNS name of a load balancer, container service, CDN distribution, or other Amazon Web Services resource and routes traffic to that resource. type (string) --- The type of domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for IPv6 (AAAA), canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server (NS), start of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT). The following domain entry types can be used: A AAAA CNAME MX NS SOA SRV TXT options (dict) --- (Discontinued) The options for the domain entry. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_params.name: id
nested_params.description: The ID of the domain recordset entry.

nested_params.name: target
nested_params.description: The target IP address ( 192.0.2.0), or AWS name server ( ns-111.awsdns-22.com.). For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com. For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net. For Lightsail container services, the value looks like container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com. Be sure to also set isAlias to true when setting up an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container service.

nested_params.name: isAlias
nested_params.description: When true, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias used by the Lightsail load balancer, Lightsail container service, Lightsail content delivery network (CDN) distribution, or another Amazon Web Services resource. You can include an alias (A type) record in your request, which points to the DNS name of a load balancer, container service, CDN distribution, or other Amazon Web Services resource and routes traffic to that resource.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The type of domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for IPv6 (AAAA), canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server (NS), start of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT). The following domain entry types can be used:

nested_params.name: options
nested_params.description: (Discontinued) The options for the domain entry.

nested_items.name: operations
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the resources affected by the request.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the operation was initialized ( 1479816991.349).

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: isTerminal
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation is terminal.

nested_items.name: statusChangedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the status was changed ( 1479816991.349).
